item.title: Quantitative Research Engineer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Quantitative Research Engineer

Job Description

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Quantitative Research Engineer to join the Quantitative Investments team at RBC Global Asset Management. As a Quantitative Research Engineer, you will collect, gather, clean, and shepherd data through alpha research, portfolio optimization, backtesting, and visualization. Your success and that of the team will be driven by your expertise in quantitative methods, financial data analysis, data validation, data governance, and data visualization combined with your passion for systematic quantitative investing and deep desire to explore and understand both established and novel financial datasets and internally derived data. You will report to the Head of Research, Quantitative Investments.

The Quantitative Investments team employs a systematic quantitative approach to the management of equity strategies implemented via mutual funds, hedge funds, segregated accounts and ETFs. The team takes a multi-factor approach to building and managing investment solutions. The models are data-driven and grounded in sound fundamental and economic rationale. It is a highly collaborative environment in which the research, portfolio management and systems development teams constantly interact. The team manages CAD$20bn of client investments.

What will you do?

  • Identify, acquire, and maintain diverse datasets to support alpha research and portfolio management of systematic equity strategies, including pricing data, fundamental accounting data, and alternative data

  • Verify and, where possible, improve the accuracy and completeness of historical datasets required for backtesting and other research purposes. Propose and document key assumptions required when building historical datasets

  • Ensure data is fit for purpose, clean, complete, and implement data validation processes to identify, flag, and rectify discrepancies or anomalies in data on an ongoing basis

  • Create data documentation and metadata to ensure data transparency and work with quantitative developers to ensure data is available to users via easy-to-use tools and APIs

  • Contribute to research engineering efforts to develop, maintain and enhance the team’s suite of visualization dashboards

  • Perform complex data analysis using advanced data manipulation techniques in Tableau, SQL, Python, Matlab, and related tools

  • Embody the following cultural edges: curious, open-minded and adaptable; eager to learn and motivated to continually improve; driven by the sense of urgency required to thrive in an era of rapid disruption; highly collaborative; and committed to a rigorous and scientific approach

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • A passion for data and data-driven investment analysis

  • Bachelor’s degree in quantitative finance, statistics/machine learning, engineering, data science, engineering, or a related field

  • 3+ years of experience in the financial industry working with financial data; experience with equity data is strongly preferred; buy-side investing experience is a plus

  • Strong understanding of key mathematical and statistical techniques that are used in quantitative investments including portfolio optimization, risk management and performance analysis

  • Expertise in data governance, data validation, and data management processes

  • Strong programming skills in SQL, Python, and Matlab with experience in data manipulation and analysis. Proficiency in Tableau or other data visualization tools (Qlik, PowerBI, etc.), with a strong understanding of best practices in data visualization and dashboard design

  • Strong collaboration skills and a pro-active approach to communication. Ability to deliver accurate results that have impact on tight deadlines

Nice to Have

  • Master’s degree in quantitative finance, statistics/machine learning, engineering, data science, engineering, or a related field

  • Completion or enrollment in CFA

  • Experience working with modern cloud-based data ecosystem

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team

  • Flexible work/life balance options

  • Opportunities to do challenging work

  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  

  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business

RBC is committed to supporting flexible work arrangements when and where available. Details to be discussed with Hiring Manager.

Job Summary

Address:

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

City:

CAN-ON-TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

Wealth Management

Job Type:

Regular

item.title: Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Manager, Reporting, Automation & Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC is currently recruiting for the exciting role of Manager, Reporting & Analytics. In this role, you will work directly with product / client partners in Client Profile Segment Team, especially the Newcomer & Cultural Client teams, to fulfill the following critical roles:

  • Support information-based business decisions by identifying, understanding, capturing, organizing, presenting, and disseminating data trends.
  • Work with business partners to grow profitable relationships with our clients and create sustainable value for RBC shareholders.

What will you do?

  • Participate in strategy meetings to provide input, gather and document business requirements, and help formulate analytical framework.
  • Influence the approach to answering business questions with deep RBC product insights.
  • Seek out new ways to engineer and manufacture best-in-class standard reports to showcase insights and support tactics.
  • Increase the standardization and efficiency of regular reporting.
  • Manage day-to-day workflow and negotiate realistic timelines.
  • Participate actively in self and peer development relating to financial products, operational processes, relationship management, and technology enhancement.
  • Ensure compliance and privacy guidelines are strictly adhered to.

Must-have:

  • 3 years of hands on experience with large relational databases and working experience with multiple querying tools such as native SQL, SAS, BI/Query
  • Proven technical experience with Tableau (desktop and server), UNIX and Windows integrated environments.
  • Be effective and equally conversant in business and technical environments.
  • Strong, innate, business and data acumen.
  • Applied data validation mechanisms.
  • Ability to thrive when working under pressure
  • Undergraduate degree in Computer Science, Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Finance, Economics, Business Administration, or other quantitative discipline.

Nice-to-have:

  • Knowledge of Teradata or DB2 is definite asset.
  • Demonstrated leadership in cross-functional environment.
  • Experience with developing reports using OLAP tools.
  • Experience with financial products and services and their corresponding data.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation
  • Opportunity to learn and apply new businesses, techniques, and ideas.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities.

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Sr. Manager, Risk Management
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr. Manager, Risk Management

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

RBC Global Asset Management (GAM) is the asset management division of the Royal Bank of Canada.  The RBC GAM group of companies manages more than CAD 550 billion in assets under management with investment teams located across Canada, the U.S., Europe and Asia. 

The RBC GAM Risk Management team provides independent oversight of RBC GAM’s investment activities across public and private markets.  The risk team is responsible for risk measurement and monitoring, risk policy and governance, providing effective challenge to investment teams, and helping to establish risk appetite.  Our stakeholders include RBC GAM clients, investment teams, regulators, and RBC GAM leaders. 

The successful candidate will be a key contributor to the RBC GAM Risk Management team with responsibilities described in the following sections. For further information, please visit: https://www.rbcgam.com/en/ca/

What will you do?

  • Research, design, and develop quantitative risk models and analysis tools

  • Conduct quantitative risk analysis on diverse investment portfolios

  • Develop and support production risk systems, including data infrastructure, analytics, reporting applications

  • Design risk metrics and set appropriate risk budgets and limits

  • Monitor and communicate risks to investment teams and executives

  • Perform root cause analysis and portfolio diagnostics

  • Quantitatively and qualitatively assess proposed new products

  • Conduct firm-level analysis including scenario analysis and stress testing

What do you need to succeed?

Must Have

  • Degree in engineering, physics, mathematics, computer science or other quantitative field

  • Strong interest in finance including equities, fixed income, derivatives, and risk analysis

  • Quantitative and technical skills, including experience with regression modelling, factor analysis, MATLAB / R / Python, C / C++ / C# / Java, SQL, Tableau / Power BI or similar tools.

  • Strong programming and code-debugging experience

  • Strong interest in data analysis, reporting, and data visualization

  • Attention to detail and strong written and verbal communication skills.

Nice To Have

  • Advanced degree (ideally PhD) in a quantitative field.

  • Experience or knowledge in finance and risk management including quantitative analysis and risk analytics.

  • Working experience with relational databases such as SQL Server and/or Oracle, including database development experience using T-SQL or Python ETL tools / libraries.

  • Knowledge of the asset management industry.

  • CFA, FRM or similar.

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation

  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities

  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact 

  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team 

Job Summary

TORONTO, Ontario, Canada

item.title: Associate/VP - Quants
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate/VP - Quants

Job Description

WHAT IS THE OPPORTUNITY?

As a front office quantitative analyst supporting the Commodities business, the candidate will be responsible for the provision of quantitative tools, analysis, and general analytical support to the trading desk. The RBC Quant team is responsible in developing & supporting next generation trading strategies and is the cornerstone of our Macro Quantitative Investment Strategies (Macro-QIS) business.

WHAT WILL YOU DO?

  • Development and implementation of tools to support trading desk, quantitative strategies infrastructure and risk management activities.
  • Gather new requirements from the trading desk and manage delivery of solutions through quant libraries and associated IT systems.
  • Maintenance and improvement of existing pricing tools and operational framework.
  • Provide general day-to-day quantitative support to trading desk.
  • Carry out special projects related to pricing models, trades, and risk management.
  • Assistance with the pricing of new products and feasibility of modelling approaches.
  • Provide desk-based research assistance as required.
  • Co-ordination with risk and functional teams as part of the process of submitting front office developed models for vetting and use in the bank\'s risk framework.
  • Help to recruit, retain and develop top talent.

WHAT DO YOU NEED TO SUCCEED?

 Must have:

  • Graduate degree in a quantitative discipline.
  • Advanced qualifications in mathematical finance and computing.
  • Strong written and oral communication.
  • At least 2 years’ experience in a similar role.
  • Programing: Python, C++, SQL.
  • Knowledge of derivative products and associated valuation methodologies.

Nice-to-have: 

  • Knowledge of Commodities, FX, and Rates derivatives.
  • Knowledge of Macro quantitative strategies and back-testing

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact.
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • A world-class training program in financial services.
  • Flexible work/life balance options.
  • Opportunities to do challenging work.

ROAR - 559979033

#LI-POST

#TECHPJ

item.title: Senior Risk Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Risk Analyst

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

The C&C Senior Risk Analyst will be part of RBC Clearing & Custody, a fast-growing business channel.  This role will interact with C&C firms, along with internal personnel, on key financial risk items related to the C&C business.  This role will work closely with C&C Risk Manager, as well as with Senior C&C Management.

What will you do?

  • Review daily risk reports, identify issues of concern, and resolve and/or escalate accordingly
  • Review financial statements and Focus reports for existing firms and identify trends, variances, etc.
  • Utilize applicable monitoring tools for the review of proprietary trading by C&C client firms
  • Monitor C&C Market Access Rule (MAR) and ACT trading limits proactively escalating limit breach concerns to interested parties as appropriate
  • Work closely with C&C firms, along with internal C&C staff, on understanding new and/or proposed C&C firm activities and associated risks
  • Document new firm risk profiles, including firm snapshot and anticipated trading activities, which are used to incorporate risk limits for C&C Risk review process
  • Function as a liaison during new firm conversion process for new C&C firms with respects to risk limits and risk set-up process
  • Escalate risk concerns and limit increases appropriately, as defined within the delegation of authority matrix
  • Other project work, analysis assignments and duties as assigned

What do you need to succeed?

Must-have

  • Risk Management experience in a Broker-Dealer or Financial Services firm
  • Ability to work and communicate with all levels of management, as well as with C&C firms
  • Ability to work independently and under pressure, all while adhering to deadlines and tight schedules
  • Ability to influence others and convey difficult messages in a clear and concise manner
  • Excellent oral and written communication skills

Nice-to-have

  • Series 7 and/or other advance licenses
  • Risk Management / Credit / Operations Background
  • Ability to adapt to an ever changing, fast paced environment

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Flexible work/life balance options
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to take on progressively greater accountabilities  
  • Access to a variety of job opportunities across business

Job Summary

•The Risk Analyst is responsible for reviewing, monitoring, and reporting financial risk associated with the Clearing & Custody business channel.
•This position will work closely with Risk Management personnel to analyze, understand, quantify and minimize financial risk to the business.

item.title: Real Estate Finance Risk Controls Analyst
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Real Estate Finance Risk Controls Analyst

Job Description

  • Assists in developing technology-based tools and performs data analysis to monitor, measure, and manage market and derivatives risks.
  • Assists in developing action plans to resolve issues. Re-designs processes to better manage, measure, and monitor market and derivatives risks.
  • Implements routine research and evaluation of the investments organization, business activities, and market and derivatives risk; assists in monitoring risk management policies, procedures, limits, and guidelines.
  • Participates in monitoring market risk to ensure that they are within market and derivatives risk thresholds, limits, and constraints. Explains market and derivatives policies and processes to other departments.

Job Summary

Implements market risk analysis and participates in implementing risk management systems and processes to minimize market risk. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.

item.title: Fin-Tech Partnership- Vice President
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Fin-Tech Partnership- Vice President

Job Description

What is the Opportunity?

The Fin-Tech Partnership Vice President for US Cash Management will have accountability for the development of external partnerships for RBC’s new Cash Management business.  The development of partnerships will be a critical building block in the cash management offering and will be needed for the go-to-market strategy to be executed in a timely fashion.   This role will be responsible for identifying, fostering, structuring, and executing partnerships. This role will report to the Director of Business Insights and External Partnerships and will need to liaise across many other verticals such as product, compliance, sales, and technology.  It will also play a strategic part in our product roadmap of the future.

What will you do?

  • Continuously review market landscape, identifying commercial deal opportunities across partners, start-ups and industry players that will position RBC as a world-class market leader
  • Identify and develop new fintech partnerships and relationships that will create value for our new stack of cash management solutions and drive C-Suite engagement to drive step function growth
  • Draw upon experience in business development and payments to identify potential deals, develop the tactics and manage the teams, process and programs needed to bring them to fruition
  • Structure, negotiate, and execute deals
    • Work across the cash management organization to ensure that deals align with product offerings and pricing strategies
    • Work with our cross-functional partners to structure acceptable deals terms (e.g., Legal)
  • Lead the deal pipeline for new fintech partners and venture activities
  • Solution / recommend, develop, and implement new and creative approaches to grow clients’ businesses  
  • Identify and drive use cases to diversify revenue concentration and build and launch best practices for approach to global deals and account management
  • Synthesize findings from across various clients and sub-sectors to develop a thesis on the future of money movement that can inform fintech BD strategy, product development, and larger conversations on industry evolution

People Leadership & Collaboration

  • Collaborates cross-functionally across Cash Management team and our functional partners to ensure successful implementation of new partnerships
  • Maintains effective relationships and routines with business leaders and program/initiative teams 

What do you need to succeed?

  • Experienced business development professional and financial services/technology sector expert who can identify potential deals and develop the tactics, teams, processes and programs needed to bring those deals to fruition
  • Experience cultivating deep partnerships with current and potential internal/external partners. Understands the payments and financial services industries and can link client needs to opportunities for future service developments or enhancements
  • Financial/payment industry knowledge required
  • Should be an excellent, creative thinker and problem solver
  • Demonstrated skill in gaining credibility with and respect of high-performing leaders within and outside the organization
  • High levels of learning agility with a real interest in the fintech ecosystem and a ‘technology / digital-first’ approach
  • Excellent listening and communication skills (both verbal and written), and executive presence
  • Ability to explain complex business and technical concepts to broad audiences in an approachable way to influence and drive adoption
  • Demonstrated success in driving revenue acceleration with new product offerings
  • Demonstrated thought leadership and the aptitude to think creatively and identify new ways to innovate and differentiate products with evidence of tangible business results
  • Ability to inspire and influence others without direct management responsibility
  • Diversity of thought and experience as well as a desire to continually seek new perspectives and feedback, take an inclusive approach, and engage diverse points of view
  • Ability to influence/operate effectively across a matrixed organization (functions & geography) to drive positive outcomes
  • Minimum of Bachelor\'s degree in related field; 7-12 years experience, with 3 years in people management.

#USACASHMGMT

What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • Opportunities to building close relationships with clients

The good-faith expected salary range for the above position is $150,000-$200,000 depending on factors including but not limited to the candidate’s experience, skills, registration status; market conditions; and business needs.  This salary range does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

Job Summary

The Fin-Tech Partnership Vice President for US Cash Management will have accountability for the development of external partnerships for RBC’s new Cash Management business. The development of partnerships will be a critical building block in the cash management offering and will be needed for the go-to-market strategy to be executed in a timely fashion. This role will be responsible for identifying, fostering, structuring, and executing partnerships. This role will report to the Director of Business Insights and External Partnerships and will need to liaise across many other verticals such as product, compliance, sales, and technology. It will also play a strategic part in our product roadmap of the future.

item.title: Associate Director, Quantitative Methodology
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Associate Director, Quantitative Methodology

Job Description

Support methodologies related to market risk management for trading or banking portfolios. This includes the specification, implementation, performance monitoring and maintenance of these methodologies. Methodology Development and Documentation: Support market risk methodology (a.k.a ‘models’) development and implementation for trading products, including vanilla bond, agency MBS, ABS, CLO, CMBS and RMBS. Market risk methodologies include, but not limited to, VaR and SVaR models based on historical simulation, statistical analysis for financial data, as well as Market Risk RWA projection. Develop computer program to implement the methodology or test methodology soundness. Act familiar with pricing models for vanilla bond, Agency MBS, ABS, CLO, including multi-factor interest rate model, prepayment model etc. Know vendor system and data for trading products, such as Polypaths, CDO net, Markit. Provide risk modeling transparency. Methodology Maintenance and Monitoring: Remediate model issues from internal validation, internal audit as well as external regulators. Re-submit model white papers on regular basis with portfolio and model features update. Work on the maintenance the existing models. This includes ensuring adequate review of the assumptions on an ongoing basis, timely calibration of the models and monitoring of model limitations. Coordinate with internal stake holders and external regulators: Work with local market risk and front office to coordinate and resolve model related issues for market risk methodologies of trading products. Interact with market data team to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the market data used to support the various models. Market data is a key underlying component for all key risk models and is accordingly a critical area of focus BAU risk management. The work related to market data will involve a significant amount of effort and change in order to comply with the Regulatory expectations. Interact with regulators regarding methodology analysis for market risk. Provide comprehensive explanation of the VaR and SVaR results to the risk managers and senior management.

Full time employment, Monday – Friday, 40 hours per week.

MINIMUM REQUIREMENTS:

Bachelor’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, or a related field and 3 years of progressive, post-baccalaureate work experience. In the alternative, will accept Master’s degree in Mathematics, Statistics, Operations Research, or related and 2 years of work experience.

Of the required experience, must have 2 years of experience in all of the following:

  • Experience in conducting testing or application of probability theory and statistics, stochastic calculus and differential equations, including normal distribution characteristics, error-
    correction models, orthogonal multivariate regression, vector auto-regression models, integration and Taylor series expansion.
  • Experience in conducting statistical tests to analyze goodness of fit of stochastic models, including Shapiro Wilk test, Durbin Watson test, Rainbow test, VIF test, Breush-Pagan test, ADF test.
  • Experience in CCAR stress test methodology development, including scenario expansion models and Market RWA projection models.
  • Experience in developing VaR and Stress VaR methodologies for Agency MBS, CLO, ABS, CMBS, Corporate bonds, Municipal bonds, government bonds.
  • Experience in conducting model testings, including correlation analysis, sensitivity analysis, stress testing and backtesting for VaR and Stress VaR models.
  • Experience in developing computer program for statistical analysis or CCAR stress testing and VaR model testing using R, Python, SQL, VBA, Tableau and Polypaths.
  • Experience in writing model documentation that meets regulatory expectations with SR-11-7 guidelines published by the Fed, and presentations for senior management (MD or VP level).
  • Experience in interaction with internal validation team, internal audit team or external regulators in resolving issues for models.

Certification: FRM, CFA (at least level I)
Telecommuting: telecommuting permitted up to 40%
Travel: International travel required up to 5%; Domestic travel required up to 5%

 
Any suitable combination of education, training, or experience is acceptable.

The base salary for this job is $126,100 per year.  This salary does not include other elements of total compensation, including a discretionary bonus and benefits such as a 401(k) program with company-matching contributions; health, dental, vision, life and disability insurance; and paid time-off plan.

RBC’s compensation philosophy and principles recognize the importance of a highly qualified global workforce and plays a critical role in attracting, engaging and retaining talent that:

·       Drives RBC’s high performance culture

·       Enables collective achievement of our strategic goals

·       Generates sustainable shareholder returns and above market shareholder value

TO APPLY: Please click the “Apply” button.

Job Summary

Address:

Jersey City, New Jersey, United States of America

City:

USA-NJ-JERSEY CITY

Country:

United States of America

40

Full time

item.title: Sr Lead Software Developer
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Sr Lead Software Developer

Job Description

  • What is the opportunity?

    In this role, you will lead and mentor a team of enthusiastic engineers building APIs and micro-services and front end applications. You will work with all stakeholders to design best in class technology solutions. 

    What will you do?

  • Develop and maintain APIs and micro-services and front end.
  • Develop and maintain front end apps using Angular framework (Angular 7 or above)
  • Lead and mentor an enthusiastic team of engineers.
  • Build reusable and fully tested (unit tests) code using Jest, Jasmine, Karma, Protractor.
  • Optimize applications for maximum usability and function.
  • Design highly scalable and extensible services
  • Create estimates for given tasks/features.
  • Design front end with the industry best practices.

  • What do you need to succeed?

    Must-have

  • Extensive experience in building Applications using Java-Spring Boot or Node.js, Angular, HTML, JavaScript, Redux, CSS, Kubernetes.
  • 2+ years of experience leading a team of engineers.
  • Strong proficiency in on-prem and/or public cloud and deployment.
  • Expertise with more than one database and related technologies (MongoDb, Elastic-Search, SQL server, Oracle, Kafka)
  • Experience with REST and/or GraphQL
  • Experience with modern dev-ops techniques experience is a must. We use GitHub, UrbanCode and Jenkins.

  • Nice to Have

  • Some experience with ReactJS

  • What’s in it for you?

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation and stock where applicable.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • A startup like environment with all the job security of the number one financial institution.
  • Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
  • Work in a friendly, dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team.
  • A world-class training program
  • Fun and supportive environment that values personal aspirations as much as the results to be delivered.

Job Summary

item.title: Senior Full-Stack Developer (Angular, Java)
item.description:
Come Work with Us!

At RBC, our culture is deeply supportive and rich in opportunity and reward. You will help our clients thrive and our communities prosper, empowered by a spirit of shared purpose.

Whether you’re helping clients find new opportunities, developing new technology, or providing expert advice to internal partners, you will be doing work that matters in the world, in an environment built on teamwork, service, responsibility, diversity, and integrity.

Job Title

Senior Full-Stack Developer (Angular, Java)

Job Description

What will you do?

  • Designing and coding application programs; performing testing for developed applications.
  • Reviewing, analyzing, and modifying programming systems, including encoding, testing, debugging and installing for a large-scale system.
  • Ensuring the operating efficiency of existing application systems. Maintaining records for the documentation of systems development and revisions.
  • Conducting analyses of organizational needs and goals for the development and implementation of application systems.

Must-Have:

  • 6+ years of experience in designing, developing, and maintaining web-based applications,  architectures and frameworks (Angular and Java)
  • 3+ years of experience development with Angular, Angular JS and micro front-end technologies
  • 3+ years of experience with Java, REST API/Micro services, Spring framework, Spring Boot (2.x), JSON, MQ,  Hibernate, SQL, Oracle
  • Knowledge of enterprise-level security concepts and methodologies, including SSO, SSL, APIGEE, encryption, authentication, and entitlements

Nice to Have:

  • Experience acting as a development lead , technical specialist in development team.
  • Working knowledge on Digital Banking would be an asset.
  • Experience working on cloud native solutions and DevOps technology experience.
  • Process knowledge including different testing tools, design techniques and tools, risk assessment and quantification methodologies

What’s in it for you?
We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.

  • A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits and competitive compensation.
  • Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
  • Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
  • Opportunities to do challenging work
  • This is a hybrid opportunity

#LI-Hybrid

#LI-Post

Job Summary

Provides information on the detailed technical design and development of applications using existing and emerging technology platforms. Applies experience and seasoned knowledge, skills, and practices to perform a variety of assignments.
